title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion
Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Issue:
Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature is eating too much code. In the given example, it is failing to include one of the method calls in the generated code.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the baz call to baz(x.x.foo()) in the provided code snippet.
2. Place the cursor after the first "x.".
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up the code assist feature.
4. Type "f" to filter the list of suggestions.
5. Select "foo()" from the filtered list.

Expected Behavior:
The code assist feature should include both method calls in the generated code.

Observed Behavior:
The code is changed to: baz(x.foo().foo())
I would rather it gave me: baz(x.foo()x.foo())

Environment:
jresdk 106

Additional Comments:
- The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.
- An option was added but later removed, which allowed the control of the amount of source to replace.
- The option has been completely removed.
